block.p: Andrea Kathleen Hayes, the daughter of Susan Allen of Southampton, N.Y., and Col. Floyd Hayes of El Mirage, Ariz., was married at her mother's house yesterday to Peter Ian Resnick, a son of Judith and Burton Resnick of Rye, N.Y. Burton B. Roberts, the retired administrative judge of State Supreme Court in the Bronx, officiated.

Mrs. Resnick, 28, works in New York at the Howard Greenberg Gallery, which specializes in photography. She is in charge of cataloging. She graduated from the University of Colorado at Boulder. Until recently, her mother was an owner of Architrove, an antiques business in East Hampton, N.Y. Her father is a retired Army officer. The bride's grandfather Herbert Allen was a founder of Allen & Company, the New York investment firm.

Andrea Kathleen Hayes, the daughter of Susan Allen of Southampton, N.Y., and Col. Floyd Hayes of El Mirage, Ariz., was married at her mother's house yesterday to Peter Ian Resnick, a son of Judith and Burton Resnick of Rye, N.Y. Burton B. Roberts, the retired administrative judge of State Supreme Court in the Bronx, officiated.

Mrs. Resnick, 28, works in New York at the Howard Greenberg Gallery, which specializes in photography. She is in charge of cataloging. She graduated from the University of Colorado at Boulder. Until recently, her mother was an owner of Architrove, an antiques business in East Hampton, N.Y. Her father is a retired Army officer. The bride's grandfather Herbert Allen was a founder of Allen & Company, the New York investment firm.

Mr. Resnick, 28, is the managing director for commercial leasing and management at Jack Resnick & Sons, a real estate development business in New York. The company was founded by his grandfather, and his father is the chief executive. The bridegroom graduated from Hobart College. His mother is a producer for Off Broadway theater.
